heaviest_rainfall.status: The heaviest total rainfall occurred on 04 January 2025, dropping 36.8mm of rain over the 37.2 hour storm duration with a maximum rate of 4.6mm per hour.

heaviest_rainrate.status: The heaviest rain was recorded on 02 September 2025 with a peak rate of 27.0mm per hour.  The storm lasted 15.0 hours and had a total rainfall of 21.19mm.

longest_rain.status: The longest rain storm on record lasted 37.2 hours on 04 January 2025 when 36.8mm of rain fell and at one point was falling at 4.6mm per hour.

most_lightning.status: Since records began on 11 April 2025, the highest lightning strike count in one day is 23 on 07 September 2025.

storm.status: A storm is in the area.  This is the first such event since 19 October 2025.

top_10_dry.status: The longest dry period started on 24 April 2025 and lasted for 19 days.

top_10_rainy.status: The longest rainy period started on 30 November 2024 and lasted for 10 days.

cold_snaps.status: There is no cold snap at the moment.  This year has experienced 6 cold snaps, with an average of 3.7 per year.

extreme.status: The record temperature difference stands at 26.7°C (0.4 - 27.1°C), set on 29 April 2025.

heatwaves.status: There is not a heatwaves right now.  There have been 6 this year, compared to a usual average of 1.9.

tropical.status: The previous tropical night was on 18 July 2025, with only 62 in total since 1973.

average.status: The current average daily wind direction is southerly (184°), which differs from the daily average south-westerly (231.0°) by approximately 47.0 degrees.    In the UK, a southerly wind usually brings milder, moist air from the Atlantic.

gusts.status: The top recorded wind gust is 93.7 mph on 13 October 2012.

run.status: The top recorded wind run is 1737 miles on 21 October 2012.

speed.status: The top recorded wind speed is 93.7 mph on 13 October 2012.

top_10_windy.status: The longest windy period started on 11 October 2012 and lasted for 21 days.

summary.description:
Today, drier conditions in rainfall (down 1.0 mm).

Compared to today, yesterday also had noticeable differences in cloud levels (up 231 m) and pressure (up 10 mbar).

The past week and month had observable variation in cloud levels (up 897 m) and dew point temperature (down 1.6°C) when compared to today.

cloud levels.description:
Today’s average cloud levels is 231.0m lower than yesterday, 612.0m lower than the past week, 897.3m lower than the past month.

Yesterday, the cloud levels ranged from a minimum of 572m to a maximum of 1380m, averaging 665.0m; the past week and month had slightly higher averages of 1277.0m and 1562.3m respectively.
cloud levels.summary: Expect overcast skies with low cloud.

summary.summary: Inside; temperature should feel pleasantly mild. Outside; mild temperatures are expected. Also, air moisture should feel ok and near calm conditions. Drizzle or light rain possible, overcast skies with low cloud, and it’s dark. Low pressure may lead to stormy or rainy weather.

washing.phrase: It is nighttime; if you have washing out then bring it in as it will probably get damper overnight.
